original_solution_mapping.L1: Linda wants to do two coats, so the total area she will be painting is 2 coats * 600 sq. ft./coat = <<2*600=1200>>1200 sq. ft.
original_solution_mapping.L2: A gallon of paint will cover 400 sq. ft., so Linda will need 1200 sq. ft. / 400 sq. ft. per can = <<1200/400=3>>3 cans of paint

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 1833.
    Returns: the number of gallon cans of paint Linda needs to buy.
    """
    # L1
    num_coats = 2 # two coats
    wall_area_per_coat = 600 # The wall area is 600 sq. ft.
    total_area_to_paint = num_coats * wall_area_per_coat

    # L2
    coverage_per_gallon = 400 # a gallon of paint can cover 400 sq. ft.
    cans_needed = total_area_to_paint / coverage_per_gallon

    # FA
    answer = cans_needed
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: Linda wants to do {num_coats} coats, so the total area she will be painting is {num_coats} coats * {wall_area_per_coat} sq. ft./coat = <<{num_coats}*{wall_area_per_coat}={total_area_to_paint}>>{total_area_to_paint} sq. ft.

A gallon of paint will cover {coverage_per_gallon} sq. ft., so Linda will need {total_area_to_paint} sq. ft. / {coverage_per_gallon} sq. ft. per can = <<{total_area_to_paint}/{coverage_per_gallon}={cans_needed}>>{cans_needed} cans of paint

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L1: Linda wants to do 600 coats, so the total area she will be painting is 600 coats * 600 sq. ft./coat = <<600*600=360000>>360000 sq. ft.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: A gallon of paint will cover 400 sq. ft., so Linda will need 360000 sq. ft. / 400 sq. ft. per can = <<360000/400=900>>900 cans of paint

explanation: Input misrepresentation. The value for 'wall_area_per_coat' (600) was used instead of 'num_coats' (2).
